subtitle: A light and tasty quiche with a Parmesan pastry. Good served hot or cold.

method.text: Sift the flour and salt together in a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the cheese and add enough cold water to form a soft dough.
Turn the dough out on a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out and use to line a 20 cm round fluted flan case. Prick the base with a fork. Chill for 20 min.

Meanwhile, preheat a medium grill. Place peppers on a grill pan, skin side uppermost. Grill for 8-10 min until the skin is black and charred. Leave to cool slightly. Carefully rub the skins off under cold running water then pat dry.
Line the pastry case with greaseproof paper. Fill with baking beans. Bake for 10 min. Remove the paper and beans and cook for a further 5 min or until firm.
Cut each pepper into large pieces. Beat together the cream cheese, eggs, cream, garlic and seasoning in a bowl. Stir in the basil.
Arrange the peppers over the pastry case. Pour over the egg mixture and smooth over the surface.
Place the flan tin on a baking tray and bake in the oven for 25 min or until just set and golden. Garnish with a sprig of basil. Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Pepper and basil quiche
